title: Canadian woman arrested at BIA with Hashish worth Rs. 360 million
byline: A 36-year-old Canadian woman has been arrested by the Customs Anti-Narcotics Bureau at Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) with Hashish valued at around Rs. 360 million, marking the largest such seizure at the airport to date.

title: 18 dead, over dozen injured in stampede at New Delhi railway station
byline: At least 18 people died, including 14 women and three children and over a dozen sustained injuries in a stampede that occurred on Saturday night at the New Delhi Railway station.

title: Mainly dry weather expected to prevail today
byline: The Meteorology Department says that mainly dry weather will prevail over most parts of the island today.

title: 13 Sri Lankans rescued from cybercrime camps in Myanmar
byline: A total of 13 out of 17 Sri Lankans who were forcibly detained in cybercrime camps in Myanmar have reportedly been rescued.

title: Adani Group to resume talks with Sri Lanka after withdrawing from project – report
byline: Top executives from the Adani Group are set to reopen discussions with the Sri Lankan government next week, just days after the company announced its withdrawal from a major wind energy project in the island nation.

title: President Dissanayake to present his first Budget in Parliament tomorrow
byline: The 2025 Government Budget is scheduled to be presented to Parliament tomorrow (17), marking the first budget to be presented by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake since assuming office.

title: Notorious drug trafficker and wife brought back to Sri Lanka
byline: A notorious drug trafficker and organized criminal, along with his wife, have been brought back to Sri Lanka after being apprehended while hiding in a foreign country.

title: Prominent Sri Lankan businessman Inayet Akbarally passes away
byline: Renowned businessman Inayet Akbarally, a prominent figure in Sri Lanka’s business community, has passed away at the age of 88.

title: Foreign liquor bottles worth nearly Rs. 10 mln seized from vehicle spare parts shop
byline: The Walana Anti-Vice Unit has confiscated a stock of foreign liquor bottles valued at nearly Rs. 10 million from a vehicle spare parts store in the Delkanda area of Nugegoda, owned by a prominent businessman who primarily imports automobile spare parts.

title: Navy sailor arrested with missing T-56 rifle
byline: A Sri Lanka Navy sailor has been arrested at his residence in Kuliyapitiya while in possession of a T-56 assault rifle that had been reported missing from the Navy armoury at the Rangalla Naval Base in Colombo since 2021.

title: European leaders set to hold emergency summit on Ukraine
byline: European leaders are set to gather next week for an emergency summit on the war in Ukraine, in response to concerns the US is moving ahead with Russia on peace talks that will lock out the continent.

title: PM Harini calls for quality teacher-student relationships in education reform
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya highlighted the critical role of teachers in shaping the future of children, emphasizing that the teacher-student relationship must be of the highest quality.

title: President Dissanayake reviews final draft of Budget 2025
byline: The final draft of Budget 2025 has been presented today (16) for Presidential review at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: Tissa Attanayake withdraws from SJB-UNP discussions
byline: SJB National Organiser Tissa Attanayake has announced that he will no longer participate in future discussions between the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) and the United National Party (UNP), as he has withdrawn from the committee appointed to hold discussions with the UNP.

title: SL Army personnel ordered to surrender passports
byline: The Sri Lanka Army has directed all personnel below the rank of Major to hand over their passports to their respective regiments, according to the Army Spokesman.
